page.title: 07COMPUTER SURVEY
page.content: We conducted a survey in the block about people's attitudes to computers. We asked 50 people of different ages questions, and we found the following results:- 1. 20% owned a computer of some kind. 2. 50% thought computers were exciting 3. 34% thought otherwise 4. 24% (mostly older folk) said we would be better off without them. 5. Most popular computer ={Spectrum 6. Majority of non-owners would use a computer for business or in home. 7. Owners liked arcade games. An increasing number of children have access to a computer at home. The Spectrum is one of the most common. {Otterton Primary School}has a{BBC computer with disk drive & printer. The children use it forWord-Processing data-bases and educational games. Survey by:A.Morrish:D.Badham:V.LeMasu
